How can I get a block template using the Verus command line tool?
You can get a block template using the Verus command line tool by running the command `verus getblocktemplate`.

Examples:
> verus getblocktemplate 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblocktemplate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
Is there an alternative way to get a block template using HTTP requests?

Yes, you can also get a block template using HTTP requests. You can use a tool like `curl` to send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus RPC server. The command would look something like this:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblocktemplate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
This command sends a JSON-RPC request to the Verus RPC server at `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with the method `getblocktemplate` and no parameters. The response will contain the block template.

Examples:
> verus getblocktemplate 
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblocktemplate", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
